meanings.definition: Emitting or resembling beams of light
meanings.sent1: The sky was filled with beamy stars that twinkled all night.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse emitted a beamy light to guide ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent3: The beamy sun smiled down on the picnic, making everyone squint.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a beamy ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The beamy glow of the fireflies lit up the dark forest like tiny lanterns.

meanings.definition: Broad in the beam; wide and spreading outwards
meanings.sent1: The old ship had a beamy hull that made it stable in rough waters.
meanings.sent2: The beamy tree branches provided ample shade on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent3: The beamy elephant waddled gracefully through the savannah.
meanings.sent4: Her beamy smile lit up the room with warmth and joy.
meanings.sent5: The beamy wings of the airplane stretched wide as it soared through the sky.

meanings.definition: Showing joy or happiness in a beaming manner
meanings.sent1: The beamy child's laughter echoed through the playground.
meanings.sent2: She gave him a beamy smile to thank him for the thoughtful gift.
meanings.sent3: The beamy puppy wagged its tail excitedly at the sight of its owner.
meanings.sent4: His beamy face brightened up the room, spreading happiness to all.
meanings.sent5: The beamy dance performance left the audience feeling uplifted and cheerful.
